intro: Ceropegia micriflora, commonly known as the small-flowered ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are often pale green or yellowish, with intricate patterns that aid in pollination by specific insects. It is a popular choice for indoor gardening due to its low maintenance and attractive appearance.
